p: Within the selected wards, all households keeping domestic ruminants and not having a history of vaccination against RVF were identified using local official veterinary records. The spatial and temporal patterns of RVF outbreaks in Tanzania; 1930 to 2007 [ 7], showed that no previous outbreak had occurred in the two study districts. It was further confirmed during the study where, in each district, the veterinary offices were asked for any occurrence of RVF disease and/or outbreak, and history of livestock RVFV vaccination. Furthermore, information on the animal movements into the selected wards was retrieved from the veterinary officials, household heads and herdsmen. Additional information on the sources of replacement heifers was also requested. Wards without inward migration of animals from other areas were selected for the study.
